title.narrative: PROVISION OF EQUITABLE Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: Water supply and sanitation services are provided and sustained through gender sensitive, community management and community based (CLTS) approaches in 15 target districts by 2016, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 85% of women and children access improved water supply facilities and 60% of households use improved sanitation and hygiene services, with a focus on vulnerable and disadvantaged communities, by end of 2016

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Water supply and sanitation services are provided and sustained through gender sensitive, community management and community based(CLTS) approaches in 15 target districts by 2016

description.narrative: Over 300,000 people gained access to sanitation facilities in cholera hot-spots, fifteen thousand people had access to safe drinking water and over one million people, including over 50% children, lived in safer and cleaner environments free of faecal matter. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2018
